poem:
**Cricket Dispatches**  

Spinning on airwaves,  
the willow whispers—  
a tumbling arc;  
newspapers lie flat—  
the ink dances.  
Qantas lifts,  
bearing tales  
of ball meeting bat,  
while voices hum  
beneath billowing clouds,  
all echoes of  
pitchside dreams.  
Ashes rise,  
an urn's small breath  
between nations,  
caught mid-flight,  
framed in fleeting sun.
